verse: For I know the plans I have for you,
plans to prosper you and not to harm you, to give you hope and a future.
reflection: In times of uncertainty and rapid change, God's plans for us remain constant. He sees the bigger picture and works all things for our good.

verse: Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters.
reflection: Our daily work, including coding and creating with technology, becomes an act of worship when done with excellence and integrity.

verse: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.
reflection: As we navigate complex technological decisions, we need wisdom beyond our own understanding to make choices that honor God.

verse: And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.
reflection: Even in disruption and change, God is working all things together for the good of those who love Him and are called according to His purpose.

verse: You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again?
reflection: As believers in technology fields, we're called to be preserving and flavoring influences in our industries and communities.

verse: For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.
reflection: Each of us is uniquely crafted by God with specific good works prepared in advance - including how we use technology to serve others.

verse: The simple believe anything, but the prudent give thought to their steps.
reflection: In an age of information overload and rapid technological change, we must be discerning about what we believe and how we proceed.
